definitions.definition: By or for the cause that; on this account that; for the reason that.
examples: I hid myself because I was afraid.

definitions.definition: As is known , inferred , or determined from the fact that.
examples: It must be broken, because I pressed the button and nothing happened.
I don't think he is a nice person, because he yells at people for no reason.

main_definition: By or for the cause that; on this account that; for the reason that.
secondary_definitions: As is known , inferred , or determined from the fact that.
( obsolete ) So that, in order that. [15th–17th c.]
